marketNews.title: RATU: Listing Day ARA, See Prospects & Analysis
marketNews.content: Raharja Energi Cepu ($RATU) officially listed on the IDX on Wednesday (8/1) at a price of 1,150 Rupiah per share and closed surging +25%, hitting the upper auto reject limit (ARA) to the level of 1,435 Rupiah per share. RATU was offered during the IPO at a valuation of 13.1x P/E 1H24 annualized, which is more premium compared to the valuation of its peers such as Medco Energi Internasional ($MEDC) at 4.9x P/E 9M24 annualized and Energi Mega Persada ($ENRG) at 5.5x P/E 9M24 annualized. We attempt to provide guidance on how investors can view and assess the prospects of this stock going forward, beyond short-term trading opportunities.

marketNews.title: Business Model and Performance in 1H24
marketNews.content:
RATU is an oil and gas (O&G) holding company owned by Happy Hapsoro. This subsidiary of Rukun Raharja ($RAJA) holds a 2.2423% participation right in the Cepu Block through an associated entity with a 49% ownership, PT Petrogas Jatim Utama Cendana (PJUC). Besides the Cepu Block, RATU also holds an 8% participation right in the Jabung Block through a subsidiary with 99% ownership, PT Raharja Energi Tanjung Jabung (RETJ).
Overall, RATU's performance still grew in 1H24, where lower production in the Cepu Block was successfully compensated by improved performance in the Jabung Block. In 1H24, RATU recorded revenues of 28 million US dollars (+143% YoY) and net profit of 7.4 million US dollars (+20.3% YoY). The Jabung Block is the main contributor to net profit with a 58% contribution, while the Cepu Block contributed 42%.
The Jabung Block was only acquired by RATU at the end of 2023 with an acquisition value of 26.5 million US dollars for an 8% participation right in that block. This acquisition value is considered attractive because it implies an acquisition valuation per O&G reserve of 1.3 million US dollars per MMBOE, much cheaper compared to several similar acquisitions by other companies recently:
- MEDC (2022) - Acquisition of 54% participation right in Corridor Block valued at 10.6 million US dollars per MMBOE
- MEDC (2023) - Acquisition of 20% participation right in Blocks 48 and 60 in Oman valued at 11.4 million US dollars per MMBOE
- Hibiscus Petroleum (2024) - Acquisition of 38% participation right in Maharajalela Block B in Brunei Darussalam valued at 12 million US dollars per MMBOE

marketNews.title: New Acquisition Plan
marketNews.content: RATU is also planning another acquisition. On October 16, 2024, the President Director of RAJA, Djauhar Maulidi, announced that the company had entered the final stage of discussions to acquire a portion of the participation rights in a new O&G block. Although he did not specify the details of the block to be acquired, Maulidi mentioned that the participation right in that block would be relatively larger than the participation right in the Jabung Block. We estimate that this acquisition will eventually be carried out by RATU, as RAJA's subsidiary in the upstream O&G sector. Although details about this acquisition are not yet known, RATU at least has a strong capacity thanks to a solid balance sheet with low net gearing at 0.15x post-IPO, meaning the company has a good starting capital.

marketNews.title: Performance Guidance
marketNews.content: RATU anticipates that total O&G production from the Jabung and Cepu Blocks in 2025 will be relatively similar to last year. Production from both blocks is only targeted to increase in 2026, especially in the Cepu Block along with further exploration activities through the Banyu Urip Infill Clastic program. Even without production increases, RATU expects revenue to grow double-digit in 2025.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Although RATU still has potential for organic growth, we believe that assessing RATU solely based on organic growth factors is not very interesting due to its premium valuation compared to its peers. We tend to assess RATU as a growth stock, where the company has the potential for significant growth, but more by relying on inorganic means through the acquisition of O&G blocks. Therefore, the main key factor for RATU is the success of the company in expanding its O&G portfolio with reasonable acquisition valuations, both by increasing participation rights in existing O&G blocks and/or acquiring participation rights in other O&G blocks. We assess that RATU's success in executing this strategy will justify RATU trading at a premium. If the aforementioned acquisition plan can be executed again at an attractive valuation, we assess this will have a positive impact on the company. However, like a double-edged sword, failure to expand the O&G portfolio with reasonable acquisition valuations becomes the main risk for investors given RATU's premium valuation, thus having a large room for potential disappointment.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia recorded that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of December 2024 increased to the level of 155.7 billion US dollars (vs. November 2024: 150.2 billion US dollars). The position of foreign exchange reserves is equivalent to financing 6.7 months of imports or 6.5 months of imports and government foreign debt payments, which is above the international adequacy standard of around 3 months of imports. The increase in foreign exchange reserves was driven by tax and service receipts, government foreign loan withdrawals, and O&G foreign exchange receipts.
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of December 2024 increased to the level of 155.7 billion US dollars (vs. November 2024: 150.2 billion US dollars). The position of foreign exchange reserves is equivalent to financing 6.7 months of imports or 6.5 months of imports and government foreign debt payments, which is above the international adequacy standard of around 3 months of imports. The increase in foreign exchange reserves was driven by tax and service receipts, government foreign loan withdrawals, and O&G foreign exchange receipts.

marketNews.title: Minister of ESDM Discusses Possibility of Cutting Industries Receiving Cheap Gas
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Tuesday (7/1) that his office is discussing the possibility of cutting the number of recipients of Specific Natural Gas Price Incentives (HGBT). Bahlil mentioned that the HGBT incentive is intended to support economic growth and enhance the competitiveness of national industry, so companies deemed to have recorded a good internal rate of return may be removed from the HGBT recipient list. Bahlil's statement came just one month after the Acting Director General of Oil and Gas at the Ministry of ESDM, Dadan Kusdiana, stated that his office received recommendations from the Ministry of Industry to add 15 new sub-sectors as HGBT recipients. Previously, HGBT recipients only consisted of 7 industrial sectors, namely ceramics, fertilizer, petrochemicals, oleochemicals, steel, glass, and rubber gloves.

marketNews.title: Minister of Industry: Indonesia to Meet Apple Investment Proposal
marketNews.content: Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, stated on Tuesday (7/1) that he met with the Vice President of Global Policy at Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL), Nick Ammann, and mentioned that negotiations for Apple's new investment proposal are underway. Agus declined to provide details of Apple's investment proposal and the Indonesian government's demands, but he asserted that an investment value of 1 billion US dollars is not enough. Previously, the Minister of Investment and Downstreaming, Rosan Roeslani, claimed that Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) had committed to investing 1 billion US dollars in Indonesia in 2026. Apple needs investment approval in Indonesia to obtain a new Domestic Component Level (TKDN) certificate so that the iPhone 16 series can be sold in Indonesia.

marketNews.title: Government Aims to Raise up to $2 Billion in Dollar-Denominated Bond Issuance
marketNews.content: Reuters reported on Wednesday (8/1) that the Indonesian government plans to raise up to 2 billion US dollars through the issuance of US dollar-denominated bonds with a tenor of 5-10 years. The Ministry of Finance declined to comment on this issue.

marketNews.title: Malaysia Imposes Temporary Anti-Dumping Duties on PET Plastic Imports from China and Indonesia
marketNews.content: The Malaysian Government announced on Tuesday (7/1) the implementation of temporary anti-dumping duties on imports of polyethylene terephthalate (PET) plastic from China and Indonesia. The anti-dumping duties range from 6.33-37.44% and are effective starting January 7, 2025.

marketNews.title: US Job Openings Increased in November 2024, Services PMI Rose, Leading to US Stock Decline
marketNews.content: The US Bureau of Labor Statistics noted that the number of job openings in the US increased by 259,000 to approximately 8.1 million in November 2024 (vs. October 2024: approximately 7.8 million), far exceeding consensus expectations of 7.70 million. In other economic data, the Institute for Supply Management noted that the Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) in the US rose to 54.1 in December 2024 (vs. November 2024: 52.1), surpassing consensus expectations of 53.3 and marking the 10th consecutive month in expansion territory during 2024. Following the release of both data points, US stock indices slumped on Tuesday (7/1) with the Dow Jones -0.42%, S&P 500 -1.11%, and Nasdaq -1.89% amid concerns that inflation rebound could slow down the pace of monetary policy easing by the Fed.

marketNews.title: Adhi Karya to Allocate Capex for 2025 and Plans to Add New Water Business Entity
marketNews.content: Corporate Secretary of Adhi Karya ($ADHI), Rozi Sparta, stated that the company will allocate capital expenditure (capex) of approximately 2-3 trillion Rupiah for 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: ~1.8 trillion Rupiah). Rozi also mentioned that ADHI will add a new executing business entity focused on managing the clean water business. Previously, ADHI through its subsidiaries and affiliates has managed drinking water supply system (SPAM) projects in Dumai City, SPAM in Karian-Serpong, and a seawater reserve osmosis technology management system.

marketNews.title: New Controller of MINA Announces Mandatory Tender Offer
marketNews.content: The new controller of Sanurhasta Mitra ($MINA), Hapsoro, announced a plan for a mandatory tender offer for up to ~2.8 billion (43.05%) of MINA shares at a price of 25 Rupiah per share from January 9 to February 7, 2025. This corporate action follows the acquisition of ~243.8 million MINA shares by Hapsoro at an average price of 23 Rupiah per share on November 20, 2024, which made Hapsoro the new controller of the company through a direct ownership of 5.73% and indirect ownership through PT Basis Utama Prima of 45.71%.

marketNews.title: East Ventures: Fore Coffee IPO is an Option Being Considered
marketNews.content: Managing Partner of East Ventures, Willson Cuaca, told Investor Daily that the visit made by Fore Coffee and East Ventures to the IDX on Tuesday (7/1) was just a casual discussion about market conditions. Nevertheless, Willson did not rule out the possibility that a Fore Coffee IPO is one of the options being considered by his party. Previously, Investor Daily reported that Fore Coffee's visit to the IDX sparked speculation about the potential IPO of the coffee start-up.

tickerNews.title: RATU Surges +25% on Listing Day, Closing at ARA of 1,435 Rupiah

tickerNews.title: BUKA Announces Cessation of Physical Product Sales on Marketplace Effective February 10, 2025
tickerNews.content: BUKA: Bukalapak announced it will cease the operational sale of physical products on its marketplace starting February 10, 2025. Nevertheless, BUKA explained that consumers can still purchase virtual products on Bukalapak, such as phone credit, data packages, and electricity tokens. Previously, in October 2024, BUKA had announced restructuring and halting operations of several business lines to achieve positive financial performance.

tickerNews.title: BBRI Allocated Rp 175 Trillion in KUR for 2025, Representing 58% of National Quota
tickerNews.content: BBRI: Bank Rakyat Indonesia received a People's Business Credit (KUR) allocation of 175 trillion Rupiah for 2025, equivalent to 58% of the national KUR quota of 300 trillion Rupiah. BBRI's KUR quota consists of 160 trillion Rupiah for micro-scale KUR and 15 trillion Rupiah for small-scale KUR. The total target for BBRI's KUR in 2025 is higher by +6.1% YoY compared to the initial 2024 target of 165 trillion Rupiah, although it is lower by -5.7% YoY compared to the revised 2024 target of 185.5 trillion Rupiah.

tickerNews.title: UNTR Monitors Inorganic Expansion Opportunities in Mineral Mining and NRE Sectors, Allocates $1 Billion Capex for 2025
tickerNews.content: UNTR: The Corporate Secretary of United Tractors, Sara K. Loebis, stated that the company continues to monitor opportunities for inorganic development in the mineral mining and new and renewable energy (NRE) segments. Although not detailing future acquisition plans, Sara mentioned that UNTR is opening expansion opportunities in several commodities such as gold, nickel, copper, and iron ore. Furthermore, Sara said that UNTR is also looking at NRE business opportunities such as run-of-river hydro, solar power, geothermal, and waste-to-energy. UNTR has allocated a capex of about 1 billion US dollars or ~16.2 trillion Rupiah for 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 21 trillion Rupiah), with 60% to be allocated to the mining contractor business line, 20% for gold and nickel mine infrastructure, and 20% for other purposes.

tickerNews.title: Morgan Stanley Sells 62.9 Million FILM Shares, Reducing Ownership to 13.419%
tickerNews.content: FILM: MD Entertainment shareholder, Morgan Stanley & Co. International plc, sold 62.9 million FILM shares at an average price of 1,196 Rupiah per share on December 24, 2024, resulting in a total transaction value of 75.25 billion Rupiah. On the same day, Morgan Stanley & Co. International plc also bought 29,300 FILM shares at a price of 3,645 Rupiah per share, resulting in a total transaction value of 106.82 million Rupiah. After these two transactions, Morgan Stanley & Co. International plc's ownership in FILM decreased from 14.0544% to 13.419%.

tickerNews.title: Rico Usthavia Frans and I Gede Darmayusa Resign from EXCL Board
tickerNews.content: EXCL: XL Axiata announced that Rico Usthavia Frans and I Gede Darmayusa have submitted their resignation letters from their respective positions as directors of the company on January 7, 2025. Rico Usthavia Frans' resignation will be effective upon approval at the nearest GMS, while I Gede Darmayusa's resignation will be effective when the merger between EXCL and Smartfren Telecom ($FREN) is declared effective. EXCL has not yet announced the schedule for the nearest GMS.

tickerNews.title: GEMS Targets 50-51 Million Tons Coal Production in 2025 with Capex of $30-35 Million
tickerNews.content: GEMS: The Corporate Secretary of Golden Energy Mines, Sudin, stated that the company targets a coal production volume of 50-51 million tons in 2025, with a sales volume target of 51-52 million tons. Both targets are unchanged compared to the 2024 targets because the coal mining work plan and budget (RKAB) system will be valid for 3 years in 2024-2026, unless revised. Sudin also mentioned that GEMS estimates it will allocate capex of around 30-35 million US dollars in 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 60 million US dollars), intended for hauling road, port, and other supporting facilities.

tickerNews.title: HOKI Appoints Indomarco (Salim Group) as New Distributor to Strengthen Market Penetration
tickerNews.content: HOKI: The Director of Buyung Poetra Sembada, Budiman Susilo, said on Tuesday (7/1) that the company has appointed Indomarco as a new distributor for the company's products, including the Topi Koki rice brand and Dailymeal healthy rice. Budiman mentioned that the distributor owned by the Salim group is the right partner for HOKI to strengthen market penetration, considering Indomarco has 600,000 active outlets in Indonesia. Future distribution of HOKI products through the Indomarco distribution network will cover modern markets, minimarkets, traditional stores, as well as other channels such as food service.

tickerNews.title: ADHI to Allocate Capex of Rp 2-3 Trillion for 2025 and Focus on Water Business
tickerNews.content: Secretary of Adhi Karya ($ADHI), Rozi Sparta, stated that the company will allocate capital expenditure (capex) of approximately 2-3 trillion Rupiah for 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: ~1.8 trillion Rupiah). Rozi also mentioned that ADHI will add a new executing business entity focused on managing the clean water business. Previously, ADHI through its subsidiaries and affiliates has managed drinking water supply system (SPAM) projects in Dumai City, SPAM in Karian-Serpong, and a seawater reserve osmosis technology management system.

tickerNews.content: Managing Partner East Ventures, Willson Cuaca, told Investor Daily that the visit made by Fore Coffee and East Ventures to the IDX on Tuesday (7/1) was just a casual discussion about market conditions. Nevertheless, Willson did not rule out the possibility that a Fore Coffee IPO is one of the options being considered by his party. Previously, Investor Daily reported that Fore Coffee's visit to the IDX sparked speculation about the potential IPO of the coffee start-up.
